greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest k < n such that prime(n-k) + prime(n+k) = 2*prime(n).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: return next(k for k in range(n)[::-1] if nth_prime(n-k)+nth_prime(n+k) == 2*nth_prime(n))
xref: Cf. A006562 (balanced primes), A178670 (number of k), A178698 (composite case), A179835 (smallest k).
results.author: _Juri-Stepan Gerasimov_, Dec 24 2010
ext: Extended and corrected by _T. D. Noe_, Dec 28 2010
